sect2.title: operatingCompany, sme:pluralName=operatingCompanies, sme:compliance=MUST, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=FALSE, sme:canDelete=FALSE, sme:isSyncSource=FALSE, sme:isSyncTarget=FALSE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Operating Company is an ‘active’ Operating Company.
Flag to indicate if Operating Company is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Additional reference for the Operating Company.
A shorter name for the Operating Company.
The Operating Company currency (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR).
Link to the Operating Company address(es).
Identifier(s) of the Operating Company as used by the third parties (e.g. Operating Company Registration Number, DUNS number, 1099 type, CIS number, siret number, etc).
The tax-locale applicable to the Operating Company (e.g. District)
Tax reference associated with the Operating Company (e.g. VAT number, numero intracommnunautaire, FEIN)
Bank account associated with the Operating Company e.g. for electronic Payment, direct debits, bank transfers, etc.
The industry code of the Operating Company.
Language used by the Operating Company (e.g. EN-GB)
Link to Child Operating Company associated with this Operating Company.
Companies can be ‘nested’ to create organizational hierarchies.
Link to Child Operating Company associated with this Operating Company.
Companies can be ‘nested’ to create organizational hierarchies.
Payment(s) associated with the Operating Company.
Project(s) associated with the Operating Company.
Notes associated with an Operating Company.
Link to the Employee(s) associated with the Operating Company
Link to the Organization(s) associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the positions associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Vacanciesassociated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Employment (contracts) associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Workplaces (e.g. offices) associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Timesheets associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the (Employee) Rates (e.g. cost, charge/billing, pay) associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Expense Claims associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Expense Categories associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Payrolls associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Payroll Elements associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the (Employee) Absences associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the (Employee) Benefits associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the vehicles associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Objectives associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Operating Companies Appraisals.
Link to the Competencies associated with the Operating Company.
Link to the Competency Groups (e.g. qualifications, syllabuses) associated with the Operating Company.
Link to any Incidents associated with the Operating Company.
Link to any Disciplinaries associatied with the Operating Company.
A link to the Training Group associated with the Operating Company.
Link to Training associated with the Operating Company.
A link to the Training Registers associated with the Operating Company.
Link to Training Events associated with the Operating Company
Working time applicable to the Operating Company.

sect2.title: organization, sme:pluralName=organizations, sme:compliance=MAY, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Organization is an ‘active’ Organization .
Flag to indicate if the Organization is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Organization.
Link to the Position(s) associated with the Organization.
The level associated with the Position within the Organization in numeric format (e.g. 1-15 in the Sage UK Career Framework or Sorting Level of Organizational Units).
The level associated with the Position within the Organization – in textual format.
The band associated with the Position within the Organization in numeric format.
The band associated with the Position within the Organization – in textual format (e.g. A-D in the Sage UK Career Framework).
Link to Parent Organization associated with this Organization e.g. into which an Employee would be promoted.
Organization are usually hierarchical to represent a career path.
Link to Child Organization associated with this Organization e.g. from which an Employee has been promoted or could be demoted.
Organization are usually hierarchical to represent a career path.
Link to the main Organization address(es)
The default Workplace associated with the Organization.
Financial (e.g. cost centre) account associated with the Organization.
Textual information associated with the Organization.
Textual information associated with the Organization.
A start date associated with the Organization (if applicable).
A start date associated with the Organization (if applicable) – e,g, to support restructuring of an Organization.

sect2.title: position, sme:pluralName=positions, sme:compliance=MAY, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Position is an ‘active’ Position.
Flag to indicate if the Position is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Position.
Department within the Operating Company the Position is for.
Link to the Organization associated with this Position.
The Position name (typically the Job name, e.g. “R&D Product Development Manager”
A shorter name for the Position (e.g. “R&D PDM”).
The Position type (e.g. Permanent, Part-Time, etc).
Employment (contract) associated with the Position. This may be prospective terms if the Position is Vacant, or actual terms if the Position is filled.
The Workplace associated with the Position.
Link to the current Position address(es)
Link to the Employee(s) associated with the Position (if any – may be Vacant).
A link to manager’s Employee record.
Textual information associated with the Position.
Textual information associated with the Position.
Date the Position was (or is to be) originated (e.g. Secondment).
Date the Position was (or is to be) closed.
A link to the Competencies required of the Position.
Flag to indicate if this Position is the primary one (e.g. for the associated Employee).
Flag to indicate if this position is held externally to the employing company (e.g. where a record is being kept of voluntary, governmental, supplementary positions).

sect2.title: vacancy, sme:pluralName=vacancies, sme:compliance=MAY, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Vacancy is an ‘active’ Vacancy.
Flag to indicate if the Vacancy is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Vacancy.
Link to the Organization associated with this Vacancy.
Link to the Position the Vacancy is for.
The Vacancy name (typically the Job name, e.g. “R&D Product Development Manager”
A shorter name for the Vacancy (e.g. “R&D PDM”).
The Vacancy type (e.g. Permanent, Part-Time, etc).
A numeric value indicating the number of Vacancy Positions that are available.
Target start date for the Vacancy (i.e. when Employee expected to start Employment).
Application closing date, after which no new Candidates will be accepted.
Value indicating the preferred application method for the Vacancy (e.g. Web, Post, Email, Agency, etc).
Date when Candidates will be assessed (e.g. when interviews, etc commence)
Details of the Employee doing the Candidate assessment. Could be many as this could be a recruiting panel.
A link to the Employee who administers the Vacancy.
Date the Vacancy is to be closed.
The Workplace associated with the Vacancy.
Link to the Employee(s) associated with the Vacancy (if Vacancy status is Appointed).
A link to a Supplier e.g. if the whole Vacancy is outsourced to a recruitment agency.
Textual information associated with the Vacancy.
Textual information associated with the Vacancy.
A link to the Competencies required in order to be suitable for the Vacancy.

sect2.title: employee, sme:pluralName=employees, sme:compliance=MUST, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: A link to the Employee Group associated with this Employee.
Employees can belong to multiple Employee Groups.
Flag to indicate if the Employee is an ‘active’ Employee .
Flag to indicate if Employee is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Reference for the Employee (e.g. Employee/Payroll number).
The Employee type (e.g. Full Time, Part Time, etc).
The gender of the Employee (e.g. Male, Female, Not Specified).
The full name of the Employee e.g. title, first name, family name, suitably spaced.
The salutation to be used when addressing the Employee (“Dear”, “Your Excellency”, etc).
The first name of the Employee.
The name preferred by the Employee – may be first name or a nick name.
Could use First Name as default
The family name (surname) of the Employee.
Any previous family name used by the Employee (before marriage).
The middle name of the Employee.
A name suffix associated with the .Employee (e.g. PhD, OBE, etc)
Financial accounting code applicable to the Employee (typically the wages/salary account).
Could be calculated from date of birth.
The date of birth of the Employee.
The city of birth of the Employee
The country of birth of the Employee
Language used (spoken) by the Employee (e.g. EN-GB).
The marital status (single, married, etc) of the Employee.
The country of residence of the Employee.
The ethnic origin of the Employee.
A flag to indicate if the Employee is registered disabled.
A numeric value associated with the Employee disability (if applicable).
A text value associated with the Employee disability (if applicable).
A start date associated with the Employee disability (if applicable).
An end date associated with the Employee disability (if applicable).
The national insurance, or country-specific equivalent, number, (e.g. numero de securite sociale).
Reference number for tax purposes of the Employee (e.g. UK UTR).
Code used for the calculation of taxes for the Employee.
In the UK this is known as the Tax Code.
Code defining the Tax Class of the Employee.
Code referring to the collective (e.g. union, minimum wage) agreement in place for the employee.
Link to the Employee address(es) (e.g. home address).
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Employee.
Link to the Bank Account (if any) associated with this Employee.
Employment (contract) associated with the Employee. May be many as Employee may have progressed through many different Employment(s) with the same Company.
Link to the Location (if any) associated with this Employee.
A link to the Competencies shown by the Employee
A flag to indicate if the Employee holds more than one Position within the Operating Company.
Position currently occupied by the Employee.
Link is 1:1 if Multiple Position Indicator = “False”
A link to manager’s Employee record.
A link to other Employee’s who may authorise transactions for this Employee.
A flag indicating the type of retirement category this employee falls/will fall in.
The statutory date of retirement as governed by applicable laws.
Date elected by the Employee for retirement.
The compulsory date of retirement as defined by the Employer.
Date the employee left the Employee of a particular Company
Date of the last working day of the Employee before leaving.
Textual reason information as to why Employee has left.
Period of notice expected from an Employee when leaving.
Time unit of measure applicable to the Employee’s notice period (typically weeks or months).
Period of notice expected from an Employer when dismissing an Employee.
Time unit of measure applicable to the Employers notice period (typically weeks or months).
Flag indicating who is giving notice of leaving – Employee or Employer.
The type of notice given by the Employee. This could be something decided by the Employee, the Employer, or through mutual agreement.
Period of probation given to an Employee (typically applies to new Employees).
Time unit of measure applicable to the Employee’s probation period (typically weeks or months).
Date a period of probation will expire or require review (if applicable).
Flag to indicate if probation has been renewed.
The passport number of the Employee
The authority issuing the Passport (e.g. UK PA).
The number of any Residence permit used by the Employee.
The date the Employee Residence permit starts.
The date the Employee Residence permit ends.
The authority issuing the Residence permit.
The number of any work permit used by the Employee.
The date the Employee work permit starts.
The date the Employee work permit ends.
The authority issuing the work permit.
The number of any Driving License used by the Employee.
The date the Employee Driving License starts.
The date the Employee Driving License ends.
The authority issuing the Driving License.
The category of the Driving License (e.g. car, PLG, HGV, motorcycle, etc).
A flag to indicate if the Driving License is suspended (Driving ban).
Emergency contact details for the Employee (in case of accident/illness)
A link to the former Employee record for the Employee, if the Employee has been Employed by the Operating Company before.
Employee Working Time Reg Opt Out Flag
Flag to indicate if the Employee has opted out of pertinent working time regulations (typically maximum work time allowed).
A link to a Supplier used to find the Employee e.g. if the Employee was sourced from a recruitment agency.
Expense Claims associated with the Employee.
Link to Objective(s) associated with this Employee.
Link to attendance on Training Events.
Rate(s) associated with the Employee (e.g. Cost, Charge, Pay)
Link to any dependents of the Employee.
Link to any Beneficiaries of the Employee (Beneficiaries may or may not be dependents).
Link to any Incidents association with the Employee.
Link to any Disciplinaries association with the Employee.
Flag to indicate if Employee is a smoker.
Flag to indicate if the Employee should be re-hired/re-employed (True means they can be re-hired)
A link to one (or more) Position(s) that may, in the future, be occupied by the Employee. Used for succession planning.

sect2.title: employeeGroup, sme:pluralName=employeeGroups, sme:compliance=MAY, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Employee Group is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Employee Group is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
If this does not exist then a dummy entry should be created, e.g. “MAS500 Employees”
A longer description of the Employee Group.
A link to other Employee Group(s) associated with this one.
Employees associated with the Employee Group.
Employees can belong to multiple Employee Groups.
Notes associated with an Employee Group.

sect2.title: employment, sme:pluralName=employments, sme:compliance=SHOULD, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Employment is an ‘active’ Employment.
Flag to indicate if the Employment is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Employment.
Link to the Position associated with this Employment.
Link to the Employee associated with the Employment.
The Employment type (e.g. Permanent, Part-Time, etc).
Type of the Employment contract given to an Employee (e.g. Casual, Home worker, Contractor, etc or “nature of contract” in France e.g. CDD, CDI, etc)
The legal category of the contract, as agreed with the relevant authorities (e.g. “cadre” in France).
The legal sub category of the contract, as agreed with the relevant authorities (e.g. “cadre” in France).
The date the Employment offer was accepted.
Reason for Employment, (e.g., New Hire, Secondment, Maternity Cover).
For some types of Employement contract it may be necessary to justify the type of contract (e.g. if contract type = CDD in France, then this will be mandatory).
The duration of the contract, as express in diration units (e.g. 6 months).
The unit of duration associated with the Employment (contract) e.g. months.
Period of notice expected when terminating the Employment (contract).
Time unit of measure applicable to the Employment’s notice period (typically weeks or months).
Period of notice expected from an Employer when terminating the Employment (contract).
Time unit of measure applicable to the Employers notice period (typically weeks or months).
Flag indicating who is giving notice of leaving – Employee or Employer.
The type of notice given by the Employment. This could be something decided by the Employment, the Employer, or through mutual agreement.
Period of probation given to an Employee when taking the Employment (contract) (typically applies to new Employments).
Time unit of measure applicable to the Employment’s probation period (typically weeks or months).
Date a period of probation will expire or require review (if applicable).
Flag to indicate if probation has been renewed.
Date the Employment is to be closed.

Reason for Employment termination (e.g. Resignation, Dismissal, End of Contract). This is different from the Employee Leave Reason on the Employee record as a particular instance of Employment may end but another one (for the same Employee) may commence.
Flag to indicate if the Employment has in fact ended.
The Workplace associated with the Employment.
Employment telephone number(s) (e.g. office, works mobile, etc)
Job Title associated with the Employment.
Job type relevant to the Job Title (e.g. Manager, Supervisor, etc)
Job qualification level relevant to the job (e.g. manual, skilled, technical, etc).
Flag to indicate if the Employment is hazardous (e.g. working in radioactive, dangerous situations).
If the Employment is hazardous then this allows for a description of the hazard.
Textual information associated with the Employment.
Textual information associated with the Employment.
Working time applicable to the Employment.
The type of payroll that will be used/associated with the Employment contract.
The payment method used in Payrolls associated with this Employment.
Frequency with which payments are made in association with this Employment (there will usually be one Payroll entry per pay frequency).
Code used during the calculation of taxes for the Payrolls associated with this Employment.
Currency of the Payrolls associated with this Employment.
The currency as used by the Operating Company, the business operating the Sage application (the “base” currency).
Rate used to convert from Employment Payroll Currency into Employment Operating Company Currency, if different.
Employment OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Employment Payroll Currency to Employment Operating Company Currency.

E.g. if the operator is division then it is Employment Values in Employment Payroll Currency / Employment OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate = Employment Values in Employment OperatingCompany currency.
Employment OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Employment Payroll Currency to Employment Operating Company Currency, if different.
Salary applicable to the Payroll associated with this Employment.
What the salary is applicable to (e.g. per Hour, per Day, etc).
Total of all salary/Payroll for the current Employment Period (usually fiscal year).
Total of all Tax for the current Employment Period (usually fiscal year).
Total of all Benefits for the current Period (usually fiscal year).
Total of all Deductions for the current Employment Period (usually fiscal year).
The work obligation associated with the Employment (and the Payroll, e.g. 35 hours per week, 12 months per year).
What the work obligation is applicable to (e.g. per Hour, per Day, etc).
Total of all Work Obligations for the current Employment Period (usually fiscal year).

The maximum amount of work permitted in association with the Employment (contract), expressed maximum work units (but see Employee Working Time Reg Opt Out Flag on Employee record – this allows an Employee to exceed maximum work where legislation allows)
What the maximum work is applicable to (e.g. per Hour, per Day, etc).
The holiday (vacation) entitlement associated with the Employment (e.g. 25 days) – CURRENT ACCUMULATION.
What the holiday entitlement is applicable to (e.g. per Hour, per Day, etc).
Total of all Holiday for the current Employment Period (usually fiscal year).
Flag to indicate if Holiday entitlement can be rolled over or carried forward (e.g. from current year to next year).
The holiday (vacation) entitlement rolled over from previous periods (if allowed) (e.g. 25 days).
The maximum holiday (vacation) entitlement that can be rolled over from previous periods (if allowed) (e.g. 5 days).
Total of all Rollover Holiday taken for the current Employment Period (usually fiscal year).
Default to zero if not used
Date any Holiday entitlement rolled over or carried forward (e.g. from current year to next year) expires.
Flag to indicate if earned Holiday (time off in leiu – TOIL) is allowed.
The eanred holiday (vacation) current entitlement (e.g. 3 days).
The maximum amount of earned holiday (vacation) that can be earned (e.g. 5 days).
Total of all earned Holiday taken for the current Employment Period (usually fiscal year).
Default to zero if not used
The sickness entitlement associated with the Employment (e.g. 0 days).
What the sickness entitlement is applicable to (e.g. per Hour, per Day, etc).
Total of all Sickness for the current Employment Period (usually fiscal year).
The absence entitlement associated with the Employment (e.g. 3 days).
What the absence entitlement is applicable to (e.g. per Hour, per Day, etc).
Total of all Absence Entitlement for the current Employment Period (usually fiscal year).
A flag to indicate if the Employment is the primary/default Employment (for the Employee).
Where Employment contracts are statistically analysed e.g. by government, then this will hold the code.
Code referring to the collective (e.g. union, minimum wage) agreement in place for the Employment.
Flag to indicate if geographic mobility is required as part of the Employment.
Flag to indicate if there is a competitor constraint in place against the Employment (e.g. must not work for a competitor organization).
A link to other Employment (contracts) associated with this Employment .e.g for contract renewals.
Financial accounting code applicable to the Employment.

sect2.title: competency, sme:pluralName=competencies, sme:compliance=MAY, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Competency is an ‘active’ Competency .
Flag to indicate if the Competency is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Link to the Competency Group this Competency belongs to.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Competency.
The Competency name (e.g. “Leadership”, “Commercial Awareness”, “Delivering Results”, “Customer Focus”, ,etc)
Textual information associated with the Competency.
Textual information associated with the Competency.
A link to the Employee associated with this Competency (see Status above).
The level associated with the Position within the Competency in numeric format (e.g. 1-5 in the Sage UK Competency Index).
If this is associated with an Employee and has Status = “Achieved” then this will be the level achieved by the Employee.

If this is associated with an Employee and has Status = “Achieved” then this will be the level achieved by the Employee.
Link to Parent Competency associated with this Competency.
Competencies are often sequential representing improvement in a particular Competency.
Link to Child Competency associated with this Competency
Competencies are often sequential representing improvement in a particular Competency.
Textual information associated with the evidence of the Competency.
Numeric information associated with the evidence of the Competency (e.g. a level or degree classification).
Textual information associated with the Competency.
Numeric information associated with the evidence of the Competency (e.g. a level or degree classification).
Date upon which a Competency started (or was achieved) by an associated Employee.
Unit associated with the Competency duration (e.g. Years).
Date upon which a Competency expires (if associated with an Employee and the Competency needs to be regularly updated).

sect2.title: competencyGroup, sme:pluralName=competencyGroups, sme:compliance=MAY, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

Details of opening times for the Workplace e.g. when deliveries can be accepted.

Link to any Incidents association with the Workplace.

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Resume is an ‘active’ one .

The resume type (actual for Employees or application for Candidates).
Candidates associated with the Resume (if Type = “Application”).

A text field where the contents of the resume can be briefly summarized.
The description of the job or position being sought, or information about the Candidates desired career path or professional objectives.
Employment history for the Candidate or Employee
Education history for the Candidate or Employee
Military history (e.g. national service) for the Candidate or Employee

Contains the qualifications of the Employee expressed as Competencies/.
Language used by the Employee or Candidate (e.g. EN-GB)

Language used by the Employee or Candidate

sect2.title: timesheet, sme:pluralName=timesheets, sme:compliance=SHOULD, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Timesheet is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Timesheet is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Additional Boolean status flag (e.g. Timesheet on hold (or “blocked”), off hold).
True is on hold, False is not on hold.
Employees own reference for the Timesheet.
Date the Timesheet document was raised.
Time the Timesheet document was raised.
The currency (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR) used on the Timesheet.
The currency as used by the Operating Company, the business operating the Sage application (the “base” currency).
Rate used to convert from Timesheet Currency into Timesheet Operating Company Currency, if different.
Timesheet OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Timesheet Currency to Timesheet OperatingCompany Currency.
E.g. if the operator is division then it is Timesheet Values in Timesheet Currency / Timesheet Operating Company Currency Exchange Rate = Timesheet Values in Timesheet Operating Company currency.
Timesheet OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Timesheet Currency to Timesheet OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
The number of lines on the Timesheet.
Should be auto-populated. Used as a cross reference to ensure Document integrity.
Total financial (revenue) value of the Timesheet.
Total financial (cost) value of the Timesheet.
Total payroll (pay) value of the Timesheet.
Total unit value of the Timesheet.
This may be different by line.
If the Timesheet forms part of a Payroll then this is a link to the Payroll entry.
The financial (revenue) rate for 1 unit used on the Timesheet.
This may be different by line.
The financial (cost) rate for 1 unit used on the Timesheet.
This may be different by line.
The payroll (pay) rate for 1 unit used on the Timesheet.
This may be different by line.
Identifier of the Project this Timesheet is for – usually on the Timesheet Line.
Project Line value for this Timesheet – usually on the Timesheet Line.
Some applications may not have Project Lines.
The reference of the ‘case’ associated with the Timesheet e.g. if the Document is for repair/fix services – usually on the Timesheet Line.
Financial accounting code applicable to the Timesheet – usually on the Timesheet Line.

The end time of the Timesheet Line (if time is tracked to this level of detail).

The financial (revenue) rate for 1 unit used on the Timesheet Line.

If the Timesheet Line forms part of a Payroll then this is a link to the Payroll Line entry.
